Substantial support services are for disabled children, young people and their parent/carers who require 
more support than is available through Low or Medium support services.
Family’s needs who are assessed to be substantial will be supported through the relevant social care team. 
These teams will be able to complete a short breaks assessment and if eligible the family will receive an 
individual package of support through a Personal Budget. This might include: 
• Individual support in the home or community (e.g. outreach)
• Direct Payments - to purchase individual support in line with the personal budget and direct payment 
policy.
• They may also be able to access the non-assessed short break activities at a subsidised rate, purchased 
through direct payments.
• A mixture of more than one of these options

answer:
If your care needs have increased in Southampton, you may be eligible for additional financial support from the council, provided you meet certain criteria.

**Key Information:**
- **Eligibility Assessment:** You will need to undergo a financial assessment to determine your eligibility for council support. This assessment will consider your financial circumstances and whether you need to contribute to the cost of your care (Document 1).
- **Support Plan:** If eligible, the council will work with you to develop a personal support plan, detailing your needs, the support you will receive, and the associated personal budget (Document 2).
- **Direct Payments:** If you qualify, you may opt for direct payments, allowing you to purchase services that meet your needs directly (Document 5).

**Next Steps:**
- **Contact Southampton City Council:** Visit their website at www.southampton.gov.uk for more information and to access the care self-assessment tool.
- **Financial Assessment:** Arrange for a financial assessment through the council to determine your eligibility for additional support.
- **Explore Direct Payments:** Consider whether direct payments might be a suitable option for managing your care needs.

For further assistance, you can reach out to the Southampton City Council's Adult Social Care department through their website or contact them directly for guidance on the application process.
